Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We note that events from the same case should have the same patient attributes age and gender and should follow a logical sequence e.g. Register patient Triage Doctor consultation Discharge. We see that 45 M appears in events 1 4 7 12 15 62 F appears in events 2 5 8 10 11 14 17 28 M appears in events 3 6 9 13 16 18 So we have three distinct patient profiles Therefore we can group by age gender

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now we must check the logical sequence and timing for each group Lets break down by group Group 1 45 M events 1 4 7 12 15 Event 1 Register patient ER at 080513 Event 4 Initial triage ER at 081050 5 min after Event 7 Xray imaging at 081542 The sequence Register Triage Xray Doctor consultation Discharge This is a logical ER visit Group 2 62 F events 2 5 8 10 11 14 17 Sequence Register Triage Lab test requested Lab test completed Doctor consultation Prescription Discharge This is a logical ER visit Group 3 28 M events 3 6 9 13 16 18 Sequence Register Doctor consultation Surgery preparation Surgery performed Recovery room Discharged This is a logical surgical case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: the events are interleaved We must ensure that the events for a given group are in increasing time order Group 1 45M events 1 4 7 12 15 timestamps 080513 081050 081542 082310 083005 increasing Group 2 62F events 2 5 8 10 11 14 17 timestamps 080702 081229 081610 082027 082254 082700 083529 increasing Group 3 28M events 3 6 9 13 16 18 timestamps 080715 081300 081645 082519 082700 084013 increasing

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: the activities for each group form a logical sequence Group 1 45M Register patient ER Initial triage ER Xray imaging Radiology Doctor consultation ER Patient discharged ER Group 2 62F Register patient ER Initial triage ER Lab test requested ER Lab test completed Laboratory Doctor consultation ER Prescription created ER Patient discharged ER Group 3 28M Register patient Surgery Doctor consultation Surgery Surgery preparation Surgery Surgery performed Surgery Recovery room Surgery Patient discharged Surgery

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: what if two different patients have the same age and gender Its possible but in this dataset we have only three distinct profiles and each profile forms a coherent journey what if the same patient comes twice The data does not suggest that the timestamps are all within a short period from 0805 to 0840 so its unlikely that the same patient would have two separate visits

Name: Validation - PE
Text: note that event 6 Doctor consultation Surgery for 28M consistent with scheduled knee surgery event 12 for group 1 Doctor consultation ER after Xray makes sense patient returned from Radiology event 8 Lab requested event 10 completed then back to ER logical doublecheck timestamps for group 3 Event 3 080715 register Surgery Event 6 081300 doctor 5.75 min later Event 9 081645 prep 3.75 min Event 13 082519 surgery 8.5 min Event 16 082700 recovery 1.7 min arthroscopy short procedure Event 18 084013 discharge 13 min plausible Therefore we are confident
